entry.title: hello world
entry.content:
.. role:: raw-html(raw)

:format: html

I am trying out blogging with OctoPress_. Here are my initial thoughts.

Some things I like:

. It's all static! -- Can't really beat this. Edit posts in your favorite text editor and publish when you are ready.

. Sass for CSS

. Decent docs

. Integrated version control

. Simple deploying

Some things I don't like:

. Lots of dependencies (almost 30 by my count).

. It took about 5 minutes to bootstrap to Ruby 1.9.2.

. Rake for everything. Can't I just add a post file?

. :raw-html:<del>Posts in markdown</del>

Here's a Jekyll plugin for Restructured Text_ instead of Markdown. To install the jekyll-rst plugin use: ::

$ pip install pygments
$ pip install docutils
$ cd <octopress-project-path>
$ git submodule add https://github.com/xdissent/jekyll-rst.git plugins/jekyll-rst

.. OctoPress: http://octopress.org/ .. Restructured Text: http://docutils.sourceforge.net/rst.html
